messages.text: For anyone that may be interested: <https://opensourcelive.withgoogle.com/events/dei|https://opensourcelive.withgoogle.com/events/dei>

attachments.title: Diversity, equity and inclusion day on Google Open Source Live
attachments.text: For this event, we have invited open source leaders and Googlers that are dedicated to creating more inclusive and diverse environments online. Join us to understand and discuss different approaches to bringing more diversity, equity and inclusion to open source.
attachments.fallback: Diversity, equity and inclusion day on Google Open Source Live

elements.text: For anyone that may be interested:

messages.text: <@UGR3910CQ>, regarding <https://twitter.com/juliainclusive/status/1365313934941650946?s=19|https://twitter.com/juliainclusive/status/1365313934941650946?s=19>, I think it isn't such a good idea to be so fuzzy about the criteria for being welcome. As stated, you have to basically do a little survey of the julia community and then determine based on that if you think your gender is underrepresented. If the meeting is targeted towards women/girls it is probably better to just say so. Otherwise it puts up a barrier for people who don't know much about julia and might not know what gender is dominating.

attachments.fallback:
<https://twitter.com/juliainclusive|@juliainclusive>: :tada:Excited to announce our first event!

We invite anyone whose gender is underrepresented in the Julia community to come hangout virtually. You are welcome to join even if you've never used Julia but have been curious about it.

More details about the event :arrow_heading_down:.
attachments.text:
:tada:Excited to announce our first event!

We invite anyone whose gender is underrepresented in the Julia community to come hangout virtually. You are welcome to join even if you've never used Julia but have been curious about it.

More details about the event :arrow_heading_down:.

elements.text: , I think it isn't such a good idea to be so fuzzy about the criteria for being welcome. As stated, you have to basically do a little survey of the julia community and then determine based on that if you think your gender is underrepresented. If the meeting is targeted towards women/girls it is probably better to just say so. Otherwise it puts up a barrier for people who don't know much about julia and might not know what gender is dominating.

messages.text: Or at least something like "Women/girls are underrepresented in the Julia community. Therefore, we would like to invite..."

elements.text: Or at least something like "Women/girls are underrepresented in the Julia community. Therefore, we would like to invite..."
